ALL USD 240 Students - Food Service Announcement

The USDA made an announcement this week stating schools could provide a free breakfast and lunch to ALL students regardless of their status from now until December 31, or when the state/federal funding runs out. We have applied for the waiver and have been approved to begin providing this service to all students starting September 4. These reports assist in funding Title and At-Risk services and add additional dollars to our schools. Application Link: https://www.usd240.org/vimages/shared/vnews/stories/594930b04f342/20-21%20HouseholdApplication.pdf

Have a great day!

Pam Irwin

Superintendent

Twin Valley Usd 240
July 4 at 1:19 AM ·

Good Evening Twin Valley Family!

I am excited to be here and working with all of you to serve the students and families that are part of USD 240.

I can honestly say that I never thought I would become a Superintendent during a pandemic, but here we are :-)!

I am planning to have a virtual parent meeting on Wednesday, July 8th at 6:30 pm. I'll post on Monday or Tuesday what format the meeting will be, either Zoom or Facebook Live. I'm still trying to figure out what we have and what's best to use to coordinate our communication.

We certainly don't have all of the answers, but we would like to share where we are with our planning process for reopening schools and our work to keep both staff and students safe. We will also discuss the timeline for when we will receive the KSDE guidance, as well as when we are hopeful to have a fairly vetted plan for the opening of the 20-21 school year.

I hope you can join us for the discussion!

Happy 4th of July!

Stay safe and have a great weekend!

Pam Irwin

USD 240 Superintendent
